summary: This is an email from a US Attorney's Office (likely SDNY) staff member regarding an application to share additional trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys. The sender seeks review of the updated sharing order application to ensure accurate description of newly received materials.

persons.name: Unknown Sender
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is updating a sharing order application to include additional trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys.

persons.name: Unknown Recipient
persons.context: The recipient of the email, who is asked to review the updated sharing order application or delegate the review to a paralegal.

connections.description: Both appear to be staff within the US Attorney's Office (SDNY), collaborating on legal document preparation and review.

events.title: Email Regarding Updated Sharing Order Application
events.description: An email is sent discussing an updated application to share additional trust and will documents related to the Epstein estate that were received over the preceding two weeks.

keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office (SDNY) was actively receiving trust and will documents from Epstein's estate attorneys as of January 2020.
A formal legal process (a sharing order application) was being used to handle and disseminate these estate documents.
The correspondence indicates ongoing posthumous legal and financial investigation into Epstein's estate.
